p:
A mixture of the above methyl ester (100 mg, 0.27 mmol) and 4-fluorobenzylamine (108 µL, 0.94 mmol) in absolute ethanol (1 mL) in a sealed tube was heated in an oil bath at 120 °C for 1 hours. The reaction mixture was concentrated under vacuum. The residue was dissolved in DMSO, and subjected to HPLC purification on C-18 stationary phase eluted with water/acetonitrile/TFA mobile phase. Collection and lyophilization of appropriate fractions provided the title compound.
1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 13.85 (br s, 1H), 9.21 (dd, J = 4.2, 1.7 Hz, 1H), 9.11 (t, J = 6.3 Hz, 1H), 8.65 (dd, J = 8.6, 1.7 Hz, 1H), 7.92 (dd, J = 8.5, 4.4 Hz, 1H), 7.45 (dd, J = 8.8, 5.9 Hz, 2H), 7.19 (t, J = 8.8 Hz, 2H), 4.63 (d, J = 5.9 Hz, 2H), 3.94 (br s, 2 H), 3.86 (br s, 2 H), 3.13 (br m, 4 H).
ES MS calcd for C 20H 19FN 4O 4S 2 463 (MH +), found 463.
